metadata.title: CVE-2018-10841 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
glusterfs is vulnerable to privilege escalation on gluster server nodes. Anauthenticated gluster client via TLS could use gluster cli with--remote-host command to add it self to trusted storage pool and performprivileged gluster operations like adding other machines to trusted storagepool, start, stop, and delete volumes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.2-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.2-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.2-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.2-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.2-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.2-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.2-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.2-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2-1').
